newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Tellus B shares surge on results talk.
newsitem.headline: Tellus B shares surge on results talk.

text.p: Foreign currency B shares of Shenzhen Tellus Machinery & Electronics Co Ltd hit their limit-up in early morning trading on Thursday on market talk that it would post good 1996 results, traders said.
The share rose HK$0.36 or 9.89 percent to HK$4 on volume of 639,700 shares at 10.35 a.m. (0235 GMT).
This is the second day in a row that the shares have hit their limit-up level. On Wednesday, they surged HK$0.33 to close at HK$3.64 on volume of 1.3 million shares.
Analysts told the Hong Kong-based newsletter China Securities Bulletin that investors were buying the shares on talk that the company had reversed losses reported for the first half of 1996.
The company said last August it lost 8.63 million yuan in the January-June period of 1996 against net earnings of 10.07 million yuan in the first half of 1995.

"Talk is swirling around the market about Tellus bringing its 1996 results into the positive territory after an unimpressive first half," an analyst with Sun Hung Kai Investment Services in Shenzhen said.
"There were also widespread rumours that the company would offer a three-for-10 rights issue for A shares," a stock analyst with a western bank said.
A company official said the firm had no plan to make a rights issue and would announce its 1996 full year results in April. She declined to give details.
